item.title: Attitudes Towards Bike Lanes In Toronto
item.description: Abstract As biking increases in the City of Toronto, so does the need for biking safety and consciousness (Khandker Nurul Habib (2014)). In an attempt to ease traffic and alleviate the dangers of biking, the City of Toronto painted bike lanes and installed rubber curbs on one of itâ€™s most prominent streets. After piloting this project, the City then conducted a survey of local pedestrians, bikers, and drivers to obtain feedback on their project (Services (2017)).

item.title: About
item.description: This is a “hello world” example website for the blogdown package. The theme was forked from @jrutheiser/hugo-lithium-theme and modified by Yihui Xie.
